alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 3:50AM MST until January 31 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTERY WEATHER FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST INTO MONDAY... .Heavier Snow in the mountains and valleys is expected to increase later Sunday with snow persisting into Monday for the mountains. Mixed wintry weather with rain, snow and a little sleet or freezing rain can be expected in the south parts of eastern Washington and Idaho Panhandle. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches valleys and up to 6 inches in the higher terrain. * WHERE...Eastport, Sandpoint, Colville, Northport, Bonners Ferry, Orin-Rice Road, Athol, Newport, Flowery Trail Road, Chewelah, Deer Park, Springdale-Hunters Road, Kettle Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Priest River. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 6 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
